```{r, include=FALSE}
# reactive data
filtered_data <- 
  reactive({
    
    res <-
      data |>
      filter(
        year %in% input$year_range[1]:input$year_range[2]
      )
    
    res <- 
      res |> 
      filter(
        severity %in% input$selected_severity
      )
    
    return(res)
  })
```

```{r}
## markers ----
getMarkerColor <- function(data) {
  map(
    data$severity,
    function(x) {
      if (x == "Toedlich") {
        "red"
      } else if (x == "Schwer") {
        "orange"
      } else if (x == "Leicht") {
        "beige"
      }
    }
  )
}

icons <- reactive({
  awesomeIcons(
    icon = 'ios-close',
    iconColor = 'black',
    library = 'ion',
    markerColor = getMarkerColor(filtered_data())
  )
})
  
output$map1 <- 
  renderLeaflet({
    leaflet(
      data = filtered_data(),
      options = leafletOptions(
        crs = leafletCRS(code = "WGS84"),
        preferCanvas = NULL
      )
    ) |> 
    fitBounds(~min(lng), ~min(lat), ~max(lng), ~max(lat)) |> 
    setMaxBounds(~min(lng), ~min(lat), ~max(lng), ~max(lat)) |> 
    addProviderTiles(
      provider = providers$OpenStreetMap.DE,
      options = providerTileOptions(minZoom = 11)
    ) |> 
    # leafletProxy funktioniert nicht. die lösung hier ist nicht optimal. 
    # muss immer die gesamte karte neu rendern...
    addAwesomeMarkers(
      group = "Marker",
      lng = ~lng,
      lat = ~lat,
      clusterOptions = markerClusterOptions(),
      icon = icons()
    )
  })


leafletOutput("map1")
```

Stadtteile
====

Spalte 1
----

```{r}
# district data
filtered_districts <- reactive({
  res <- 
    filtered_data() |> 
    st_as_sf(coords = c("lng", "lat"), crs = "WGS84") |> 
    rename(
      points = geometry
    ) |> 
    st_join(
      y = sf.districts |> rename("district_shape" = geometry),
      join = st_within,
      left = TRUE
    ) |> 
    select(-m2) |> 
    as_tibble() |> 
    left_join(
      y = sf.districts |> rename("district_polygon" = geometry) ,
      by = "district"
    ) |>
    drop_na(district) |>
    mutate(
      district = as_factor(district) |>
        fct_infreq() |>
        fct_rev()
    ) |> 
    add_count(district) |> 
    select(district, district_polygon, n) |> 
    unique()
  
  if (input$selected_scale == "absolute") {
    res <- 
      res |> 
      st_as_sf()
  }

  if (input$selected_scale == "norm") {
    res <-
      res |> 
      mutate(
        n = n/max(res$n)
      ) |> 
      st_as_sf()
  }  
  
  if (input$selected_scale == "relative") {
    res <-
      res |> 
      mutate(
        n = n/max(cumsum(res$n))
      ) |> 
      st_as_sf()
  }
  
  return(res)
})

labels <- function(data) {
  glue::glue(
    "{data$district}: {round(data$n, digits = 2)}"
  )
}


output$map2 <- 
  renderLeaflet({
    leaflet(
    data = filtered_data(),
    options = leafletOptions(
      crs = leafletCRS(code = "WGS84"),
      preferCanvas = NULL
    )
  ) |> 
  fitBounds(~min(lng), ~min(lat), ~max(lng), ~max(lat)) |> 
  setMaxBounds(~min(lng), ~min(lat), ~max(lng), ~max(lat)) |>
    addProviderTiles(
      provider = providers$Stamen.TonerBackground,
      group = "Stadtteile",
      options = providerTileOptions(minZoom = 11)
    ) |> 
    addPolygons(
      data = filtered_districts(),
      group = "Stadtteile",
      opacity = 1,
      weight = 0.5, 
      fillOpacity = 0.8,
      color = "black",
      fillColor = ~colorNumeric("viridis", n)(n),
      highlightOptions = highlightOptions(
        color = "white", 
        weight = 2,
        bringToFront = TRUE
      ),
      label = labels(filtered_districts())
    )
  })


leafletOutput("map2")
```

```{r}
output$district_plot <- renderPlot({
  plot <- 
    filtered_districts() |>
    ggplot(aes(x = district, y = n)) +
    geom_bar(
      aes(fill = n),
      stat = "identity"
    ) +
    scale_fill_viridis() +
    theme(
      axis.title = element_blank(),
      legend.title = element_blank(),
      panel.background = element_blank()
    ) +
    coord_flip()
  
  if (input$selected_scale == "relative") {
    plot <- 
      plot +
      scale_y_continuous(
        labels = scales::label_percent(accuracy = 1)
      )
  }
  
  return(plot)
})

plotOutput("district_plot")
```

Über {data-width=350}
----

###

<h4>Über</h4>

Dieses Dashboard visualisiert Unfälle mit Personenschaden, die sich im Stadtgebiet Regensburg zugetragen haben. Die entstammen dem deutschlandweiten Unfallatlas des statistischen Bundesamts (LINK).

Es entstand als Teil meines Abschlussprojekts des Kurses "Daten Visualisieren" der Universität Regensburg. Der Rest des Projektes kann kann unter meiner [persönlichen Website](https://www.kdschneider.github.io/unfaelle-regensburg), bzw. auf [Github](https://www.github.com/kdschneider/unfaelle-regensburg), gefunden werden.

```{r}
output$data_table <- DT::renderDataTable({
  filtered_data() |> 
    select(year:street_condition) |> 
    mutate(
      hour = glue::glue("{hour}:00 Uhr"),
      weekday = case_when(
        weekday == "Mon" ~ "Mo",
        weekday == "Tue" ~ "Di",
        weekday == "Wed" ~ "Mi",
        weekday == "Thu" ~ "Do",
        weekday == "Fri" ~ "Fr",
        weekday == "Sat" ~ "Sa",
        weekday == "Son" ~ "So"
      )
    ) |> 
    DT::datatable(
      colnames = c(
        "Jahr" = "year",
        "Monat" = "month",
        "Zeit" = "hour",
        "Tag" = "weekday",
        "Schwere" = "severity",
        "Licht" = "light_condition",
        "Boden" = "street_condition"
      )
    )
})

DT::dataTableOutput("data_table")
```
